trans-unit.source: title: Setup Windows Containers in place
trans-unit.target: title: Setup Windows Containers in place

trans-unit.source: Preparing a physical machine or an existing virtual machine for Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Preparing a physical machine or an existing virtual machine for Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.
trans-unit.target: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.

trans-unit.source: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers on bare metal or in an existing virtual machine running Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview.
trans-unit.target: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers on bare metal or in an existing virtual machine running Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview.

trans-unit.source: Other getting started guides:
trans-unit.target: Other getting started guides:

trans-unit.source: Run Windows Server Containers in [Azure](./azure_setup.md).
trans-unit.target: Run Windows Server Containers in [Azure](./azure_setup.md).

trans-unit.source: Run Windows Server Containers in [a new Hyper-V VM](./container_setup.md).
trans-unit.target: Run Windows Server Containers in [a new Hyper-V VM](./container_setup.md).

trans-unit.source: **PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE:** The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).
trans-unit.target: **PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE:** The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).

trans-unit.source: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.
trans-unit.target: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.

trans-unit.source: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.
trans-unit.target: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.

trans-unit.source: System (or VM) requirements:
trans-unit.target: System (or VM) requirements:

trans-unit.source: System running Windows Server Technical Preview 3 Server Core.
trans-unit.target: System running Windows Server Technical Preview 3 Server Core.

trans-unit.source: 10GB available storage for OS Base Image and setup scripts.
trans-unit.target: 10GB available storage for OS Base Image and setup scripts.

trans-unit.source: Administrator permissions on the machine or VM.
trans-unit.target: Administrator permissions on the machine or VM.

trans-unit.source: Setup an existing Virtual Machine or Bare Metal host for Containers
trans-unit.target: Setup an existing Virtual Machine or Bare Metal host for Containers

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers require the Container OS Base Image.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers require the Container OS Base Image.

trans-unit.source: We have put together a script that will download and install this for you.
trans-unit.target: We have put together a script that will download and install this for you.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to configure your system as a Windows Server Container Host.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to configure your system as a Windows Server Container Host.

trans-unit.source: Start a PowerShell session as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Start a PowerShell session as administrator.

trans-unit.source: This can be done by running the following command from the command line.
trans-unit.target: This can be done by running the following command from the command line.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the title of the windows is "Administrator: Windows PowerShell".
trans-unit.target: Make sure the title of the windows is "Administrator: Windows PowerShell".

trans-unit.source: If it does not say Administrator, run this command to run with admin priveledges:
trans-unit.target: If it does not say Administrator, run this command to run with admin priveledges:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to download the setup script.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to download the setup script.

trans-unit.source: The script can also be manually downloaded from this location - [Configuration Script](http://aka.ms/setupcontainers).
trans-unit.target: The script can also be manually downloaded from this location - [Configuration Script](http://aka.ms/setupcontainers).

trans-unit.source: After the download completes, execute the script.
trans-unit.target: After the download completes, execute the script.

trans-unit.source: The script will then begin to download and configure the Windows Server Container components.
trans-unit.target: The script will then begin to download and configure the Windows Server Container components.

trans-unit.source: This process may take quite some time due to the large download.
trans-unit.target: This process may take quite some time due to the large download.

trans-unit.source: The machine may reboot during the process.
trans-unit.target: The machine may reboot during the process.

trans-unit.source: When finished your machine will be configured and ready for you to create and manage Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container Images with both PowerShell and Docker.
trans-unit.target: When finished your machine will be configured and ready for you to create and manage Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container Images with both PowerShell and Docker.

trans-unit.source: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.
trans-unit.target: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps - Start Using Containers
trans-unit.target: Next Steps - Start Using Containers

trans-unit.source: Now that you are running Windows Server Containers, jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
trans-unit.target: Now that you are running Windows Server Containers, jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.

trans-unit.source: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and Docker
trans-unit.target: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and Docker

trans-unit.source: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Back to Container Home
trans-unit.target: Back to Container Home
